results.firPara: Raheem Sterling is the standout beneficiary so far of the Pep Guardiola effect at Manchester City, having already won two penalties, created a further goal, and is once again the fleet-footed, dribbling menace who moved the club to pay £49m to Liverpool for him last summer.
results.secPara: Guardiolas management of a footballer he called in the close season to offer assurance is paying dividends and the Catalan has praised Sterling for his focus and determination to elevate his game.
results.webTitle: Pep Guardiola praises Raheem Sterling for his ‘mental strength and focus’

results.firPara: Celtic fans react to Uefa disciplinary proceedings and the fundraising campaign

results.webTitle: Celtic fans share their views on Uefa fine and fundraising for Palestinian charities

results.firPara: Answer a simple question and you could be off to Stamford Bridge to watch live Premier League football
results.secPara: The Guardian has teamed up with Carabao Energy Drink to give six lucky readers the chance to win a pair of home tickets to Chelsea v Burnley on Saturday 27 August at 3pm. Recently kicking-off a new global partnership with Chelsea FC, South-East Asian energy drink Carabao – newly launched in the UK – is the clubs official training wear partner for the next three seasons.
results.webTitle: Win a (home) pair of Premier League tickets to Chelsea v Burnley

results.firPara: Phil Jones is content to stay at Manchester United, and José Mourinho has no desire to see him leave, despite Stoke City being the latest club to express an interest.
results.secPara: United have rejected several inquiries this summer for Jones as Mourinhos position remains that the central defender is a key part of his defence.
results.webTitle: Phil Jones to stay at Manchester United despite Stoke City interest

results.firPara: A look at how the 20 clubs have done in this transfer window – and the two previous summer ones. Light blue indicates a player signed and dark blue a player sold. Hover over the circles for the name of each player.
results.webTitle: Premier League: transfer window summer 2016 – interactive

results.firPara: Answer a simple question and you and some friends could be off to a luxury matchgoing experience at the Emirates Stadium
results.secPara: The Guardian has teamed up with Arsenal Football Club to offer our readers the chance to win a 15-seater executive box for Arsenal Legends v Milan Glorie at Emirates Stadium on Saturday 3 September.
results.webTitle: Win a 15-seater executive box for Arsenal v Milan legends match

results.firPara: West Bromwich Albion have told their defender Jonny Evans that he will not be leaving the club this summer.
results.secPara: The 28-year-old has been linked with a move to Arsenal but there has been no official bid from the London club and reports of West Brom demanding £25m for the Northern Irishman are wide of the mark.
results.webTitle: West Bromwich tell Jonny Evans he will not be sold this transfer window
